column4: grip says it can't initialize /dev/scd0..anyone know what the problem could be?
if beos had more apps, or if mac osx would be released on x86, i'd switch from linux.
it's absurd that in an era like this, os choices are limited to such crap.
frustration leads to disillusionment... why is linux so cr*p?
the entire structure of any *nix is steeped in decades of legacy.
DNS root hierarchy structure... seems to work fine imho.
in beos, for instance, i had an dynamic-attribute-based 64-bit journalled file architecture.  never had to run any ckfs.  never had a search take longer than 1 second.
i don't know anything about beos.
what kernel are you rebooting on?
it sucks.  i only like gnome, kde, and flux.
normally the ugrade des that for you, no?
depends if that is heavy or not ;)
i.e; in a virtual desktop? no idea
i can. i prefer kde to gnome....
i know kde has some features gnome doesn't.
